definition.name: NXafm
definition.doc: An application definition to describe atomic force microscopy (AFM).

field.name: definition
field.doc: Name of the definition that is used for the application.

field.name: scan_mode
field.doc:
The mode of the scan.
contact mode: Cantilever moves on the sample surface in very close contact with the sample. non-contact mode: Cantilever oscillates above the sample surface without touching it. Cantilever stays in the interaction (atomic force) zone therefore cantilever oscillator amplitude and frequency are deformed. tapping mode: Resembles to the non-contact mode, but at every point of scan the cantilever tip comes very close to the sample surface and taps it. peak force tapping mode: Like the tapping mode, but at each point of the scan force-distance curve is recorded. The maximum force is used to control the cantilever position using a PID feedback loop.

group.doc: The group explains the core instruments' setup of the AFM experiment as well as the environment of the corresponding instruments.

group.name: photo_detector
group.doc: Information about the quadrant photodiode deflection detector.
The sensor information for the photodiode.

group.name: cantilever_oscillator
group.doc:
When a cantilever is oscillated close to its resonance, this describes the oscillator properties.
A cantilever can be used in direct contact mode to detect interaction forces or oscillated close to its resonance frequency. Changes in the oscillation amplitude, phase (between oscillated tail and moving tip) or resonance frequency are very sensitive to changes in the interaction potential field, giving rise of various measurement modes, such as non-contact or intermittent-contact (tapping) modes.

field.name: reference_amplitude
field.doc:
The reference amplitude (also called drive amplitude) of the cantilever. This is the amplitude of the cantilever oscillation when no external forces are acting on it.
Note: At least one from reference_amplitude, reference_frequency, or reference_phase is expected.

field.name: reference_frequency
field.doc:
The reference frequency (also called drive frequency or resonance frequency) of the cantilever.
Note: At least one from reference_amplitude, reference_frequency, or reference_phase is expected.

field.name: reference_phase
field.doc:
The reference phase of the cantilever.
Note: At least one from reference_amplitude, reference_frequency, or reference_phase is expected.
